intro: Anchusa hispidissima, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of bright blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its distinctive blue flowers and medicinal properties. Anchusa hispidissima is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its role in supporting pollinators.
